title: Total urinary polyphenol excretion: a biomarker of an anti-inflammatory diet and metabolic syndrome status.
abstract: Chronic inflammation is associated with noncommunicable diseases, including obesity, metabolic syndrome (MetS), and CVDs. The Mediterranean diet has been shown to have strong anti-inflammatory effects, attributed in part to the polyphenol richness of many of its components.
journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition
